snippet.title: Takuyo Mix Box: First Anniversary opening
snippet.description:
http://www.otakuxgamer.com


NCSX's description:

Our first Takuyo-published game import was a Saturn title named E'tude Prologue. That was back in the winter of 1998 when Sega's Saturn was still in contention. Takuyo had published Super Famicom and Gameboy games prior to their transition to the Saturn and eventually the Dreamcast and Playstation 2 where it unleashed a bevy of RPGs and interactive adventures. The company's still going strong and this summer, they're releasing a collection of 10 mini-games featuring characters culled from 10 selections in Takuyo's library of software as follows:

e'tude prologue (Sega Saturn, 1998)
Kaitou Apricot (Dreamcast and Playstation 2, 2003)
for Symphony ~with all one's heart~ (Dreamcast, 2003)
Cherry Blossom (Dreamcast and Playstation 2, 2004)
Little Aid (PC and Playstation 2, 2005)
HimeHibe -princess days- (Playstation 2, 2006)
panic palette (Playstation 2, 2007)
Sorayume (Playstation 2, 2008)
HimeHibe -New Princess Days!!- Zoku! Ni-Gakki (Playstation 2, 2009)
Kaeru Batake de Tsukamaete (Playstation 2, 2010)

Fans get to challenge an assortment of characters in the various mini-games, watch a new cinematic introduction, and win credits upon successful completion of the mini-game challenges. The credits may be used to purchase and unlock special features in the software such as voice samples, illustrations, and BGM.
